text:
Word was never meant to do layout. It's job was mainly to handle text. However, they added some layout features to it.

If you have time and it's driving you crazy enough and people would accept the format downstream, try Microsoft Publisher if you have access to it.

text:
I _think_ something like that is possible in Word as well, but it's not described as such and needs pretty much black magic to get it working (I have a document with table cells split across pages, but I have no idea how I managed to do that). My colleagues and I always joke when someone has a Word issue that they just forgot to sacrifice a chicken first! :wink:
But in all seriousness, table-based templates are evil. And I say that as someone who had to use such a template for my CV...
